metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7395 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
SkPath.cpp in Skia, as used in Google Chrome before 53.0.2785.89 on Windowsand OS X and before 53.0.2785.92 on Linux, does not properly validate thereturn values of ChopMonoAtY calls, which allows remote attackers to causea denial of service (uninitialized memory access and application crash) orpossibly have unspecified other impact via crafted graphics data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7395` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1142
chromium-browser-l10n - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1142
chromium-chromedriver - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1142
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1142
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1142
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.17.7-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.17.7-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.17.7-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqmlscene - 1.17.7-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.17.7-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.17.7-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.17.7-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

firefox - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '53.0.2785.143-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1142').
oxide-qt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.17.7-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
firefox package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '50.1.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
android: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
wine-gecko2.21: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
wine-gecko-2.21: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
